summary: This document is a chain of emails between real estate attorney Jacqueline Hudkins and FBI Special Agent Michael Livingood, regarding the property at 338 E. Washington Road, Bradford, NH, where Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested. Hudkins, who handled the purchase closing for the property, offers to provide her file to the FBI investigation, prompting an introduction to Special Agent Amanda Young.

persons.name: Jacqueline Hudkins
persons.context: Attorney who handled the purchase closing for the property at 338 E. Washington Road, Bradford, NH, where Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested. She initiates contact with the FBI to offer her file.

persons.name: Michael Livingood
persons.context: FBI Special Agent based in the Boston office. He is contacted by Jacqueline Hudkins and facilitates her connection to the agent investigating Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Amanda N. Young
persons.context: FBI Special Agent who is introduced to handle the follow-up regarding Ghislaine Maxwell and the property information offered by Attorney Hudkins.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the FBI investigation. She was arrested at the property located at 338 E. Washington Road, Bradford, NH.

persons.name: Jen Marshal
persons.context: Named, along with Steve Marshal, as a client who retained Attorney Hudkins for the purchase of the property via Granite Reality, LLC.

persons.name: Steve Marshal
persons.context: Named, along with Jen Marshal, as a client who retained Attorney Hudkins for the purchase of the property via Granite Reality, LLC.

connections.description: Attorney Hudkins contacts Special Agent Livingood, having previously met him at a professional conference, to offer assistance in the Ghislaine Maxwell investigation.
Special Agent Livingood introduces Special Agent Young to handle the follow-up with Attorney Hudkins regarding the Maxwell case.
Attorney Hudkins states she was retained by Jen and Steve Marshal to handle the purchase closing for the property where Maxwell was arrested.
Attorney Hudkins states she was retained by Jen and Steve Marshal to handle the purchase closing for the property where Maxwell was arrested.
Special Agent Young is assigned to follow up on information related to the investigation of Ghislaine Maxwell.

events.title: Arrest of Ghislaine Maxwell
events.description: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested at the property located at 338 E. Washington Road, Bradford, NH.

events.title: Mortgage Banker's Conference
events.description: Jacqueline Hudkins and Michael Livingood met at the Mortgage Banker's conference in Portsmouth, NH.

events.title: Attorney Contacts FBI
events.description: Jacqueline Hudkins sends the initial email to FBI Special Agent Michael Livingood offering information about the property where Maxwell was arrested.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell was arrested on July 2, 2020, at 338 E. Washington Road, Bradford, NH.
The property was purchased by an entity called Granite Reality, LLC, represented by attorney Jacqueline Hudkins, who was retained by clients Jen and Steve Marshal.
Attorney Hudkins proactively contacted the FBI to offer her case file related to the property's purchase, suggesting it may contain information relevant to the Maxwell investigation.
The email chain shows coordination between the FBI's Boston office (Agents Livingood and Young) to collect potential evidence following Maxwell's arrest.
Hudkins indicates she will require a subpoena to formally release her client files due to ethical obligations as an attorney.
